author: holgerd77
content:
Won't die on that hill but I stumbled upon this couple of times more when thinking about it.

So another coding principle to apply here might be to get *inconsistent data out as early as possible in a call chain*. So I find it somewhat unnecessary to allow "junk on the chain" (as you stated yourself) if it is possible to catch this one step before (when I am looking at our implementation, it does not complicate/bloat things but instead the check just moves from b (execution) to a (tx validity).

So I would have a slight preference to move this check to tx validation.
(if there is no reasoning I am not aware like "keeping things more flexible for - cross-chain ? - use cases or whatever)

author: lightclient
content: you're changing tx validation from only need a single signature and balance check to needing to compute every signature in the auth list and do a balance check for each. even if this is simple to implement, it can be expensive

content: Ah, ok, thanks, that makes a lot of sense!
